jsmobileconf

  • View On GitHub

This project is maintained by evandana

JS Mobile Conf Notes

Host: Progress Software (my notes)

“jsMobileConf is a two-day, two-track, developer event focused on mobility and the cutting-edge JavaScript ecosystem.”

TakeAways

  • If you need benefits of binary, there are tons of tools to make it less “scary” (ref)
  • If native is important, use NativeScript or React Native (ref)
  • ML Kit + Firebase makes intro to ML easy (ref)
  • FaaS is just GCP Cloud Functions: make ‘em simple and pure (ref)
  • Save $$ by moving static assets to CDN and route APIs to FaaS (ref)
  • Many tools exist for handling various offline scenarios, but conflict resolution is hard (do it at data store layer) (ref)
  • Use gethuman.com to skip wait times at call centers (ref)
  • For lean app SDLC, focus on real product with only core features (test and iterate!) (ref)
  • Guide the direction of JS: It’s easy and cheap to become a member of Ecma (ref)
  • Encourage employee growth to benefit your company (ref)
  • Save $$ and facilitate offline app use with service workers (ref)
  • Quick ML Kit setup with NativeScript/React Native (ref)
  • ASTs allow context-sensitive code refactoring (ref)

ToDo

  • Project with NativeScript
  • Project with Reacrt Native
  • Project with ProtoBuffers

Projects

  • w/ NativeScript (project)
  • w/ React Native (project)

Sessions

  1. Evolution of the JavaScript, Todd Anglin, Progress
  2. Responsive Design: Beyond Our Devices, Ethan Marcotte, Independent web designer
  3. JavaScript Binary Data
  4. One Project. One Language. Three Apps.
  5. Human VS AI
  6. The FaaS and the Serverless
  7. Building Rich Offline Apps
  8. Lean Native
  9. Standardizing JavaScript, Jory Burson, Bocoup
  10. Building an Innovation Engine Inside Your Org, Anton Hristov, Progress
  11. Building Progressive (web) Apps
  12. Machine Learning on the Go with TensofFlow.js
  13. Machine Powered Refactoring
  14. Machine Learning Capabilities for Mobile Apps coming soon
